Multiple versions of the claim have been: indicating a long history of misinformation surrounding the topic.
The original photograph used in one vers: but it does not actually depict two oceans meeting. Smith himself explains that the photo shows fresh water glaciers melting into the saltier ocean.
The second version of the claim uses scr: Canada. The original video clearly states that it shows the river water (Fraser River) flowing into the ocean water (Strait of Georgia).
Expert testimony from Jay Cullen: a Professor of Chemical Oceanography, confirms that the phenomenon depicted in the claim is not the meeting of two oceans, but rather the presence of fronts caused by contrasting water densities and the entry of freshwater from rivers into the marine environment.
